answers.answer: Since you have gd the baby might be a lot when its born so you would have to get a cesarean. If you go at 38 weeks the baby will be fully developed and not weigh as much so this way you can have a vaginal birth. But go with your gut, if you feel something isn't right i would talk to her about it

As far as i know the baby is ready at 37 weeks and just gets more "plump" the remaining weeks.. i dont think your midwife would want to induce you if she thought it would be of any harm to your baby :)Id like to be in that position really ! I have a feeling my little one is gonna take her sweet time :P
You should go what your heart tell you I'm due the 22 too and I wish my doctor will tell me that lol I know I'm gonna go over my due date.  By the way what are you having ?
I'm due on the 22nd also..tomorrow I go to my Dr appt and I'm gonna beg him to induce me...lol! Your baby is fully developed and should be in head downposition also..I say go for it and get induced:)

Try to avoid being induced, unless there is a real and serious medical need (if GD is bad might be a reason, as that can cause serious complications.   No intervention should be taken lightly, as they tend to lead to other interventions and many times c section.   I was given pit. I didn't even need. It lead to horribly painful contractions (has been bare able) and eventually a section.
Im having a little boy :), thanks for everyones comments its really helped me out. Hopefully everything goes well

question: Im 37weeks and 6days pregnant and a first time mum. Im due on 22nd April but my midwife said they want to induce me at around 38weeks. Everyone has told me to not go ahead with it because the baby isn't ready to come out and it may lead to a c-section (I also have gestational diabetes) im sooo confused.  What should I do??
title: 37weeks + 6days, HELP !!!
